title: Edit AFL flows in OO Workflow Designer
content:

In Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer, you can edit AFL flows in the GRAPH or PROPERTIES tab. You can edit the following:

  • cut or copy and paste steps
  • change starting step of a flow
  • select and move multiple steps
  • create or delete a transition 
  • drag response to the canvas
  • flow properties
Note: Debugging for AFL flows isn't supported.

View AFL flows

To view AFL flows in OO Workflow Designer, in the Projects pane, navigate to the folder containing the flow, and double-click the flow. The selected flow displays in the authoring pane. 

To view step information of a step in the canvas, see View step details in AFL flows.

Edit steps and responses

Cut or copy steps

You can copy an existing step in the flow. To copy a step in the flow:

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane and select the step you want to copy.
  2. Click Cut  or Copy  icon in the toolbar or right-click on the step and select Cut or Copy. 
  3. Click Paste  icon in the toolbar or right-click in an empty area in the canvas and select Paste. The selected step is added to the canvas.
  4. On each step you pasted in the canvas, click the icon representing one of the response ports, and drag a line to the destination step for that response.
  5. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Change starting step of a flow

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane and select the step you want to add as a first step.
  2. Delete the navigation line or transition from that step.
  3. Drag this step and move it to the first step in the flow.
  4. Add the navigation line or transition to the next step and response.
  5. Right-click on the first step and select Set as Start Step.
  6. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Select and move multiple steps

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane and select the steps and/or responses you want to move.
  2. Using the mouse pointer, move the steps in the canvas. The transitions associated with them also move along with the steps.
  3. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Drag response to the canvas

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane and select the step you want to add as a first step.
  2. To add Success and Custom result points to the flow, drag result steps from the Results toolbar, and place them next to the step connected to it.
  3. Click the icon that represents one of the response ports, and drag a line to the result step for that response.
  4. To copy, cut, paste, and rename a result step, select it and use appropriate icons from the authoring pane toolbar: 

    To copy a result step, click the Copy  icon in the authoring pane toolbar or press CTRL C keys, then Click or press CTRL+V keys to paste.
    To cut a result step, click the Cut icon in the authoring pane toolbar or press CTRL X, then Click or press CTRL+V keys to paste.
  5. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Add or delete transitions

You can delete an existing transition and create a new transition. You can't edit or reassign transitions.

Delete transition

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane and select an existing transition you want to delete.
  2. Click the Delete icon in the toolbar or right-click the transition and select Delete.
  3. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Add transition

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane.
  2. On each step you want to connect to the next step (or to a result step), click the icon representing one of the response ports, and drag a line to the destination step for that response.
  3. Repeat the process for the other response icons on the step.
  4. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Edit flow properties

  1. Open the flow from the Projects pane and click the PROPERTIES tab. 
    The PROPERTIES tab displays the flow's properties. It includes:
    Tab Description
    Inputs Displays the flow inputs. Selecting a step input will populate the Inputs details panel on the right.
    Outputs Displays the flow output. Displays the flow outputs as step outputs when you use the flow as a step.
    Responses Displays the responses dragged to the canvas for the flow.
    Description Shows a summary of what the flow does.
    Scriptlet Displays the formatted JavaScript code added for the selected flow. 
  2. Modify these properties as required. You can add, edit, or delete Inputs, Outputs, Responses, Description, and Scriptlet.
  3. Click the Save icon in the toolbar to save the flow.

Limitations

The following limitations apply when you're editing AFL flows:

  • Can't delete steps
  • Can't edit callouts
  • Can't create new callouts
  • Can't edit or reassign transitions
  • Debugging for AFL flows isn't supported
